column4: Hey all, Im trying to install a webserver with Ubuntu Server Edition, OpenSSH (I will be installing LAMP later) and after I select OpenSSH Server, I hit continue and get an error at 85% completion. Can anyone help me?
did you run the 'check this CD' util on the install CD? one of the menu options early in the install process
no, Im rather new to this.
run that, it does an integrity check on the install CD.
where do I find this? Im deep into installation
I think it's in the very first menu you see after the install CD starts up.
if the install is failing anyway, you might as well.

It told me my disk was perfect, so I began the installation process and now its asking me "Please insert the dis labeled: 'Ubuntu -Server 8.04.2 _Hardy Heron_ - Release i386 (20090121.1)' in the drive /cdrom/ and press enter"
assuming that's the CD you've already got in there, what happens when you hit Enter?
takes me back to the same screen
odd. not sure what to suggest, aside from "try a cold reboot & restart the whole install", which is the brute-force option...
Im now at the stage "software selection" if I do not choose any software, can I download it at a later date?
error again.  "An installation step failed. You can try to run the failing item again from the menu, or skip it and choose something else. The failing step is: Select and install software."
odd. I've never used the server install, but that doesn't sound right
